snippet: Young people and the low-skilled will continue to be affected the most, according to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.
abstract: Study published by Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development says rising unemployment in Europe is expected to continue through end of 2014; forecasts rates of 28 percent in Spain and Greece, 12.5 percent in Italy and 11 percent in France; young people and low-skilled will be affected most.
lead_paragraph: Young people and the low-skilled will continue to be affected the most, according to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.

headline.main: Joblessness to Keep Rising, O.E.C.D. Forecasts
headline.print_headline: Jobless Rate Will Continue to Increase in Europe, O.E.C.D. Forecasts

keywords.value: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development
keywords.name: organizations
